title: for a discussion of the constitutional obligation of state government to provide minimal subsistence to the poor. The Connecticut Supreme Court concluded, in that case, that the Connecticut Constitution does not compel the state to provide minimal financial assistance. Consequently, a statute limiting benefits for indigent persons to nine months does not violate the state constitution. A related case
dealing with the city’s decision to close a homeless shelter, was decided similarly. 48
